Article.ArticleTitle: Effective toluene oxidation under ozone over mesoporous MnO<sub>x</sub>/γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> catalyst prepared by solvent deficient method: Effect of Mn precursors on catalytic activity.

AbstractText: In this study, the role of manganese precursors in mesoporous (meso) MnOx/γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> catalysts was examined systematically for toluene oxidation under ozone at ambient temperature (20 °C). The meso MnOx/γ-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> catalysts developed with Mn(CH<sub>3</sub>COO)<sub>2,</sub> MnCl<sub>2</sub>, Mn(NO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>.4H<sub>2</sub>O and MnSO<sub>4</sub> were prepared by an innovative single step solvent-deficient method (SDM); the catalysts were labeled as MnO<sub>x</sub>/Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>(A), MnO<sub>x</sub>/Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>(C), MnO<sub>x</sub>/Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>(N), and MnOx/Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>(S), respectively. Among all, MnO<sub>x</sub>/Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>(C) showed superior performance both in toluene removal (95%) as well as ozone decomposition (88%) followed by acetate, nitrate and sulphated precursor MnO<sub>x</sub>/Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>. The superior performance of MnO<sub>x</sub>/Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>(C) in the oxidation of toluene to CO<sub>x</sub> is associated with the ozone decomposition over highly dispersed MnO<sub>x</sub> in which extremely active oxygen radicals (O<sup>2-</sup>, O<sub>2</sub><sup>2-</sup> and O<sup>-</sup>) are generated to enhance the oxidation ability of the catalysts greatly. In addition, toluene adsorption over acid support played a vital role in this reaction. Hence, the properties such as optimum Mn<sup>3+</sup>/Mn<sup>4+</sup> ratio, acidic sites, and smaller particle size (≤2 nm) examined by XPS, TPD of NH<sub>3</sub>, and TEM results are playing vital role in the present study. In summary, the MnO<sub>x</sub>/Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> (C) catalyst has great potential in environmental applications particularly for the elimination of volatile organic compounds with low loading of manganese developed by SDM.
